hero.title: Water Resources Engineering & Climate Center
hero.description: We advance socio-hydro-climate understanding and co-create innovative approaches to build a sustainable and resilient future for water, climate, and society.

about.title: Data, Innovation, and Resilience
about.desc: A hub for integrated water–climate research, education, and outreach at Universitas Gadjah Mada.

card1.title: Hydro-Climate Informatics
card1.desc: Advanced models, decision-support systems, and digital platforms (incl. GIS and integrated modeling) to predict and mitigate water-related risks.

card2.title: Community-Based Management
card2.desc: Empowering local communities through participatory irrigation, rural water development, and watershed conservation with training and consultancy.

vision.title: Socio-Hydro-Climate leadership for resilience
vision.desc: Water Resources Engineering and Climate Center (WRECC) is committed to advancing scientific research, technological innovation, and policy integration to achieve sustainable water and climate resilience across regions.
vision.point1: Research, education, and capacity building. Future problem-solvers on integrated water, climate, and social equity issues. The exchange of ideas among scholars and trainees through a Socio-Hydro-Climate Engineering hub that integrates natural and social sciences, public health, design, engineering, and governance.
vision.point2: Innovation partnerships. Build collaborative networks among academia, government, industry, and civil society to translate research into real-world solutions.
vision.point3: Sustainable and inclusive development. Align all research and innovation with the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs).

scope.title: Advancing Socio-Hydro-Climate Research
scope.desc: Our interdisciplinary research integrates hydrology, climate science, and community-based approaches to tackle water challenges at every scale.

item1.title: Historical and Future Hydro-Climate Database
item1.desc: A comprehensive database of past and projected hydrological and climate data supports trend analysis, scenario modeling, and long-term planning for sustainable water management and climate adaptation.

item2.title: Sosio-Hydro-Climate and Innovative Technologies
item2.desc: Research and development focus on innovative tools that integrate social, hydrological, and climate knowledge to improve water security, enhance climate resilience, and support sustainable irrigation and community water management.

item3.title: Hydro-Climate Informatics and Technology
item3.desc: Development of advanced models and digital platforms focuses on managing water, climate, and environmental data. This includes hydroinformatics, GIS analysis, and integrated modeling to predict and mitigate water-related risks.

item4.title: Community-Based Management
item4.desc: To empower communities to co-manage water resources through participatory irrigation, rural water development, and watershed conservation, while building capacity and improving governance to ensure resilient and sustainable water and climate systems.

milestones.title: Roadmap to 2040
milestones.desc: We are setting long-term goals to strengthen climate-adaptive research and build lasting impact.
milestones.item1: Establish a 5-Year Research Roadmap for climate-adaptive irrigation, flood & drought resilience, climate projections, and the water-energy-food nexus.
milestones.item2: Launch annual joint research programs, international publications, policy briefs, seminars, and workshops with partners.
milestones.item3: Expand short courses and training for governments and communities to strengthen water & climate adaptation capacity.
milestones.item4: Achieve full integration of research, education, and outreach; become a national & Asia-Pacific reference hub.

team.title: Researchers with diverse expertise
team.desc: Our team consists of researchers with diverse expertise, dedication & extensive experience in research and development to address global challenges in sustainability and environmental resilience

contact.title: Get in touch
contact.desc: We’d love to collaborate on research, training, and community impact.
